title: Quran-Based Islamic Accounting Simulation Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic accounting terminology and digital device proficiency
context.additional_context: A VR-based program for secondary learners in their teens performing clerical/administrative tasks, enabling mastery of accounting practices grounded in Islamic economic principles

learning_goals: Learners can explain Islamic accounting principles reflecting Quranic teachings (e.g., prohibition of riba, zakat calculation) with 80% accuracy.
Learners successfully complete three or more Islamic banking transaction scenarios via VR simulation.
Learners describe the Quran-based accounting decision-making process in four or more specific stages during formative assessment.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
